title: SoC CSD 369-0-21 Special Topics in Communication Sciences and Disorders

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course investigates normal aging as it affects communication, with the understanding that everyone experiences adult developmental changes in speech, language, and hearing, and that such changes are modifiable. Major age-related challenges to communication are reviewed, including hearing difficulties, dementing disorders, and aphasia. Attention will be paid to relevant research methods, social perceptions of aging, and the relationship between physical, cognitive, and sensory functioning in later life. As time allows, the psychological and social consequences of communication problems for older adults and their families will be discussed.
